lead_paragraph: Sudep kills an estimated 2,600 Americans a year, but most neurologists don’t bring it up. Estimating the risk is uncertain, and there are no proven ways to prevent it.

headline.main: A Risk for Sudden Death in Epilepsy That Often Goes Unmentioned

snippet: Sudep kills an estimated 2,600 Americans a year, but most neurologists don’t bring it up. Estimating the risk is uncertain, and there are no proven ways to prevent it....
abstract: Federal government, prodded by advocates, has begun effort to understand sudden unexpected death in epilepsy, or Sudep; question remains when, or if, patients should be warned about condition that kills 2,600 Americans a year.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: New York University Langone Medical Center
